title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: article describes process import assessments conducted Beaufort Assessment Model (BAM) create multi-fleet operating models (OMs) openMSE framework.

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: latest versions MSEtool bamExtras need installed GitHub: package versions used create article:

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: number simulations (nsim) number projection years (proyears) need specified OM. setting global variables OM create number stochastic simulations projection years: OM also requires specification Observation Model. Observation Model used simulate fishery data used management procedures projection phase closed-loop simulation testing. using Perfect_Info fishery data currently used within management options (static management options currently explored). can changed later dynamic management options respond observed fishery data added analysis.
code: nsim <- 50 # number of simulations proyears <- 20 # number of projection years Obs_Model <- Perfect_Info

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: current analysis focused Red Snapper Gag Grouper stocks. MSE framework flexible, stocks can added analysis. demonstrate creating OMs two case study stocks, third stock Black Seabass. recent BAM assessments used: Red Snapper SEDAR 73 Gag Grouper SEDAR 71 Black Seabass SEDAR 76

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
code: RS_rdat <- bamExtras::rdat_RedSnapper |> bamExtras::standardize_rdat() GG_rdat <- bamExtras::rdat_GagGrouper |> bamExtras::standardize_rdat()  BS_rdat <- bamExtras::rdat_BlackSeaBass |> bamExtras::standardize_rdat()

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: BAM2MOM function used create openMSE operating model objects: OMs can now used within openMSE framework. However, , important understand fleet structure within OM.
code: RS_OM <- BAM2MOM(RS_rdat, stock_name='Red Snapper') GG_OM <- BAM2MOM(GG_rdat, stock_name='Gag Grouper') BS_OM <- BAM2MOM(BS_rdat, stock_name='Black Seabass')

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: order combine single stock OMs together, OM must fleet structure stocks OM, even fleets actively fishing particular stock. stocks fleets common (e.g., Commercial hook line (cHL)) unique fleets (e.g., Gag Grouper Commercial dive (cDV)). landings discards also modeled separate fleets BAM models (indicated ‘.D’). landing discard components fleet combined single fleet selectivity retention curve. Black Seabass stock two commercial fleets (cHL cPT), discards reported two fleets combined (cGN.D). deal , cHL cPT landing fleets first combined together, discards added combined fleet. Mapping variable describes fleets combined together. end result fleet structure four fleets stock: Commercial Line Recreational Headboat General Recreational Commercial Dive
code: fleet_names_df <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper', Fleets=names(RS_OM@Fleets[[1]])),   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper', Fleets=names(GG_OM@Fleets[[1]])),   data.frame(Stock='Black Seabass', Fleets=names(BS_OM@Fleets[[1]])) )  fleet_names_df |> dplyr::filter(Stock=='Red Snapper') #>         Stock Fleets #> 1 Red Snapper    cHL #> 2 Red Snapper    rHB #> 3 Red Snapper    rGN #> 4 Red Snapper  cHL.D #> 5 Red Snapper  rHB.D #> 6 Red Snapper  rGN.D fleet_names_df |> dplyr::filter(Stock=='Gag Grouper') #>         Stock Fleets #> 1 Gag Grouper    cHL #> 2 Gag Grouper    cDV #> 3 Gag Grouper    rHB #> 4 Gag Grouper    rGN #> 5 Gag Grouper  cHL.D #> 6 Gag Grouper  rHB.D #> 7 Gag Grouper  rGN.D fleet_names_df |> dplyr::filter(Stock=='Black Seabass') #>           Stock Fleets #> 1 Black Seabass    cHL #> 2 Black Seabass    cPT #> 3 Black Seabass    rHB #> 4 Black Seabass    rGN #> 5 Black Seabass  cGN.D #> 6 Black Seabass  rHB.D #> 7 Black Seabass  rGN.D fleet_df <- data.frame(Code=unique(fleet_names_df$Fleets))  fleet_df$Name <- c('Commercial Line',                    'Recreational Headboat',                    'General Recreational',                    'Commercial Line - Discard',                    'Recreational Headboat - Discard',                    'General Recreational - Discard',                    'Commercial Dive',                    'Commercial Pot',                    'Commercial General - Discard')  fleet_df$Mapping <- c(1,2,3,1,2,3,4,1,1) fleet_df$Type <- 'Landing' fleet_df$Type[grepl('\\.D', fleet_df$Code)] <- 'Discard' fleet_df #>    Code                            Name Mapping    Type #> 1   cHL                 Commercial Line       1 Landing #> 2   rHB           Recreational Headboat       2 Landing #> 3   rGN            General Recreational       3 Landing #> 4 cHL.D       Commercial Line - Discard       1 Discard #> 5 rHB.D Recreational Headboat - Discard       2 Discard #> 6 rGN.D  General Recreational - Discard       3 Discard #> 7   cDV                 Commercial Dive       4 Landing #> 8   cPT                  Commercial Pot       1 Landing #> 9 cGN.D    Commercial General - Discard       1 Discard

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: discard mortality needs added OMs historical effort can adjusted account fish caught released alive, discard mortality can modified projections. discard mortality Red Snapper reported Table 6 SEDAR 73. TheYear variable indicates first year discard mortality changes: discard mortality Gag Grouper reported SEDAR 71, fixed discard mortality 0.4 commerical fleet, 0.25 recreational fleets years: discard mortality Black Seabass reported Section 2.2.1 SEDAR 76. average discard mortality calculated combined commercial line pot fleets: stock-specific discard mortality dataframes combined together:
code: discard_mortality_RS <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper',              Code='cHL',              Year=c(1900, 2007, 2017),              Prob_Dead=c(0.48, 0.38, 0.36)),   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper',              Code='rHB',              Year=c(1900, 2011, 2018),              Prob_Dead=c(0.37, 0.26, 0.25)),   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper',              Code='rGN',              Year=c(1900, 2011, 2018),              Prob_Dead=c(0.37, 0.28, 0.26)) ) discard_mortality_GG <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper',              Code='cHL',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.4),   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper',              Code='rHB',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.25),   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper',              Code='rGN',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.25) ) discard_mortality_BS <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass',              Code='cHL',              Year=c(1900, 2007),              Prob_Dead=c(mean(0.14,0.19), mean(0.14, 0.068))              ),   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass',              Code='rHB',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.152),   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass',              Code='rGN',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.137) ) discard_mortality <- dplyr::bind_rows(discard_mortality_RS,                                       discard_mortality_GG,                                       discard_mortality_BS)

title: Creating Operating Models from BAM Output
text: Next, Aggregate_Fleets function used aggregate fleets together according mapping defined fleet_df discard mortality added discard_mortality. Aggregate_Fleets function five things: Combine landing fleets mapped together fleet_df (applies Black Seabass) Add discard mortality fleet Combine discard fleets landing fleets produce single fleet selectivity retention curves Add dummy fleets (F=0 years) OMs missing fleets Order fleets OMs
code: RS_OM <- Aggregate_Fleets(RS_OM, fleet_df, discard_mortality) GG_OM <- Aggregate_Fleets(GG_OM, fleet_df, discard_mortality) BS_OM <- Aggregate_Fleets(BS_OM, fleet_df, discard_mortality)

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Hordyk (2024). SAMSE: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation. R package version 0.0.0.9004, https://blue-matter.github.io/SAFMC-MSE/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SAMSE: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation},   author = {Adrian Hordyk},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9004},   url = {https://blue-matter.github.io/SAFMC-MSE/}, }

title: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation
text: South Atlantic Fishery Management Council (SAFMC) working Blue Matter Science Ltd. conduct Management Strategy Evaluation (MSE) describe expected outcomes different management approaches Snapper-Grouper Fishery.
